intro: Lotus ciliatus, commonly known as the silky lotus, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It features delicate, fern-like leaves with silky hairs along the edges, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and water features.
